author: Aris Folley
description: Welcome to The Hill's Business & Economy newsletter {beacon} Business & Economy Business & Economy   The Big Story  Trump axes labor statistics chief after bad jobs report President Trump ordered the firing of the commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics following a dismal jobs report he blamed squarely on the appointee of former...
title: Trump rages over bad jobs report

author: Brooke Migdon
description: Wagner College, a small, private liberal arts college in Staten Island, N.Y., has agreed to comply with the Trump administration’s restrictions on transgender student-athletes following a federal investigation that stemmed from an incident at a women’s fencing competition in March, the Education Department announced on Friday.  The department’s Office for Civil Rights (OCR) launched an...
title: College at center of USA Fencing fight agrees to deal with Trump admin on trans athletes

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele, an ally of President Trump, scored a Friday win after the country's lawmakers passed constitutional amendments eradicating term limits.  The measure was passed in a 57-3 vote just one year after Bukele broke with the law setting term limits by saying he would seek a second term as president.  The...
title: Trump ally Bukele secures path to indefinite reelections in El Salvador

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump on Friday accused the head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) Erika McEntarfer of faking jobs numbers, directing his team to fire the former President Biden appointee.  Trump blamed McEntarfer for the bad Friday jobs report, showing that the country added 258,000 fewer jobs in May and June than previously reported.  The...
title: Who is Erika McEntarfer, labor statistics chief sacked by Trump

author: Aris Folley
description: Sen. Susan Collins (R-Maine), head of the Senate Appropriations Committee, announced Friday afternoon that the chamber will be moving forward to pass its first tranche of government funding bills for fiscal year 2026. The chamber will vote on three full-year funding plans that cover the departments of Veterans Affairs and Agriculture, the Food and Drug...
title: Senate strikes deal to approve funding bills ahead of August recess

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Ohio Sen. Bernie Moreno (R-Ohio) on Friday threatened to pull federal funding from the Cincinnati after the fallout following a viral video of a 3 a.m. brawl in the streets of the city.  The altercation, which occurred on Saturday, resulted in serious injuries for one woman after a physical fight between two men that spiraled...
title: Moreno threatens to cut federal funds to Cincinnati over bloody brawl

author: Julia Manchester
description: Congressional Hispanic Caucus Chair Adriano Espaillat (D-N.Y.) accused Texas Republicans of silencing Latino voters with their proposed redistricting plan in a letter first obtained by The Hill on Friday.  In a letter addressed to J.M. Vasut, chair of the Texas Committee on Redistricting, and the committee’s Jon Rosenthal, Espaillat described the new congressional map proposed...
title: Congressional Hispanic Caucus chair accuses Texas Republicans of silencing Latino voters with redistricting plan

description: Plus: Markets plunge amid jobs, tariff uncertainty ... Ghislaine Maxwell transferred ... The Labor Department reported the U.S. economy added only 73,000 jobs in July, below estimates. The unemployment rate...

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) said Friday afternoon that whether a deal is reached on 160 stalled nominees hinges on talks between the White House and Senate Democrats, and didn’t sound confident an agreement could be reached before the weekend. Thune said “a number of people involved” from the White House are in discussions...
title: Thune: Deal on nominees up to Democrats and White House

description: Rep. Rob Bresnahan (R-Pa.) dismissed the idea of directing his financial advisers to halt any stock trades amid his difficulties in establishing a blind trust that meets his standards, suggesting he would “lose money and go broke.” Bresnahan, who has come under heat for continuing stock trades carried out by his advisers despite writing in...
title: GOP congressman suggests he’d ‘lose money and go broke’ if advisers stop stock trades

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: Sen. Elissa Slotkin (D-Mich.) said Thursday that she would have voted to block arms sales to Israel over hunger in Gaza after missing a series of Senate votes Wednesday night to appear on Stephen Colbert’s show. The Michigan senator said she was worried about the lack of food and medicine entering Gaza, and that “images...
title: Slotkin says she would have voted to block arms sales to Israel

author: Julia Manchester
description: Virginia gubernatorial nominee and Lt. Gov. Winsome Earle-Sears (R) clashed with CNN reporter Manu Raju on Friday over her past criticisms of President Trump.  Raju pressed Earle-Sears over the Trump administration’s cuts to the federal workforce this year, which have had a significant impact on Virginia, given its large population of federal workers.  “Do you...
title: Virginia GOP candidate, CNN host tangle on air over Trump questions

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: President Trump said Friday that the U.S. is positioning two nuclear submarines in “appropriate regions” near Russia, a move he blamed on threatening rhetoric from former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev, who remains a top Kremlin adviser. Trump cited in a Truth Social post what he called “highly provocative statements” from Medvedev, and said he made...
title: Trump announces nuclear submarines positioned near Russia

author: Jonathan Zimmerman, opinion contributor
description: The US is allowing China to intimidate Chinese students in the US, and universities are staying silent due to the billions of dollars they bring in tuition fees, while the US government is also harassing international students for their pro-Palestinian comments and social media posts.
title: Colleges must speak up for their Chinese students

title: Travel company responds to White House's use of popular meme: 'Very disappointed'

author: Jared Gans
description: The main super PAC affiliated with President Trump reported nearly $200 million in the bank as it looks ahead to the 2026 midterms in which control of Congress will be up for grabs.  MAGA Inc., which was key in promoting Trump’s 2024 presidential campaign, reported $196.1 million in cash on hand in a mid-year filing...
title: Trump's super PAC reports nearly $200 million war chest

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: Recently removed members of a Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) vaccine advisory panel warn that Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s move to replace them shows he is “abandoning” rigorous scientific review and open deliberation.   Kennedy fired all 17 sitting members of the Advisory Committee on...
title: Fired vaccine board members warn of fallout from RFK Jr. policies

author: Julia Shapero
description: Apple expects to face $1.1 billion in tariff-related costs next quarter, on top of $800 million from the previous three-month period, Apple CEO Tim Cook said Thursday.  The iPhone maker, which has been hit particularly hard by President Trump’s tariff push, still reported strong quarterly earnings, posting $94 billion in revenue and $23.4 billion in...
title: Apple expecting $1.1B in tariff costs next quarter

author: Sen. John Kennedy (R-La.), opinion contributor
description: Congress needs to hold cities accountable for holding back first-time home buyers by incentivizing new home construction and stripping funding from those that don't increase their rate of homebuilding.
title: Congress must hold cities accountable for holding back first-time home buyers

description: Ghislaine Maxwell, the longtime associate of Jeffrey Epstein, was quietly transferred from a federal prison in Florida to a federal prison in Texas, according to a Bureau of Prisons official.  “Ghislaine Maxwell is in the custody of the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) at the Federal Prison Camp (FPC) Bryan in Bryan, Texas,” BOP official Benjamin...
title: Epstein associate Maxwell quietly moved from Florida to Texas prison

description: Flags in the Sunshine State are being flown at half-staff Friday in honor of Hulk Hogan, the professional wrestler who died from a heart attack last week at the age of 71. Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) also proclaimed Aug. 1 as “Hulk Hogan Day” and called the wrestler a “true Floridian." "His larger-than-life personality...
title: DeSantis orders flags at half-staff in honor of ‘true Floridian’ Hulk Hogan

author: Mike Lillis
description: Democrats on Capitol Hill are hammering President Trump and his GOP allies for Friday’s underwhelming jobs report. Released by the federal Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), the analysis revealed that U.S. employers added 73,000 jobs in July — well below economists’ estimates of 100,000 — while the figures for May and June were revised dramatically...
title: Democrats bash Trump, GOP over disappointing jobs report: ‘Awful’

description: Former House Speaker Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.) argued Thursday night that former Vice President Kamala Harris’s upcoming book about her unsuccessful 2024 presidential run against President Trump will instruct potential candidates for office on “how not to run a campaign.”  “She was destroyed in every single swing state. Remember this, she lost women at a lower...
title: McCarthy: Harris book will instruct people 'how not to run a campaign'

description: While the Democratic Party was in great need of appealing to voters fed up with defenders of the existing order, Harris opted to emphatically represent the status quo.

description: Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer (N.Y.) on Friday blasted President Trump’s management of the economy after a new report from the Labor Department reported that the economy created only 73,000 jobs in July and revised down the job gains for May and June by 258,000. “It is disturbing to say but the chickens are coming...
title: Schumer on weak jobs report: 'Chickens are coming home to roost' on trade war

author: Hope McAlee
description: A Thorn Hill man is facing charges after a police investigation into a suspicious vehicle at a convenience store ended with a bomb squad being called because of suspected explosive devices early Friday morning.
title: Tennessee police find explosive devices inside suspicious vehicle

description: A weak jobs report Friday and major downward revisions to May and June employment figures have set off alarm bells about the direction of the U.S. economy. The U.S. added only 73,000 jobs in July and the unemployment rate stayed flat at 4.2 percent, according to data released Friday by the Labor Department. That was...
title: Live updates: Stocks plummet on Wall Street as jobs report, revisions set off economic alarm bells
